course_title: Special Topics Seminar: Race & Marketing in US History
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 21 / Seats Avail: 13Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: Food, music, clothing; each of these objects has inherent utilitarian value, but upon commodification additional factors come to play most notably, race. In this course we will examine the inextricable link between business practice and race, tracing how understandings of race have evolved over time through the lens of marketing tactics. We will study this change over time from the era of Jim Crow segregation in the early 20th century, to the thriving post-World War II economy, to more recent decades when discussions of identity politics have increased.
course_description: This advanced course explores one of a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in the fields of human and civil rights, social and literary texts, and the social sciences.
